title: Remove the spell vamp on Lee's W
body:
**EDIT FOR CLARIFICATION PURPOSES:**
Lee Sin's W, Iron Will, currently gives him 5/10/15/20/25% Lifesteal and Spellvamp for 4 seconds dependent on rank. I am suggesting we remove Spell Vamp so he can only heal from autoattacks during his W. Potentially increase the Lifesteal to 10/15/20/25/30% or 15/20/25/30/35% if it seems too drastic to take away the spell vamp

To balance Lee Sin I think we need to take away certain random bonuses instead of focusing on nerfing his core gameplay. 

He doesn't need Spell Vamp since he already has lifesteal, although this would impact some of his dueling and jungle which is honestly fine given how well he can gank and teamfight at pretty much any point in the game.

If it doesn't change the way that anyone plays him, then why would you remove it?

It's a completely harmless benefit, and it has been a part of his kit since his release. 

and another thing is that Lee didn't get anything for the removal of his attack speed debuff on tempest, so at some point you can't keep gutting his kit or he will no longer be a Lee Sin. 

How many times will noobs post on a forum to get X nerfed, when in fact they weren't adjusting their play style for the enemy team composition? It's like bitching that enemy team Katarina is wrecking face, but none of you or your team decided to bring even one form of cc or displacement. You lose the right to cry about it if you don't select your champions accordingly. 

Also, counterplay to Lee is very simple. Just dodge his Q and you won't find yourself Insec'd into the enemy team. :)

Let me ask you this then: If you need to reduce a champion's power would you rather have them nerf their iconic abilities that give the champion their identity or the extra tidbits that don't effect the play-style but are there only to give the champion unneeded strengths.


Why does lee sin need the spell vamp when he already has life steal and the attack speed boost on his passive to increase that life steal? I am not asking for his core mechanics, his identity, to be removed, what I am asking for is the removal of an unnecessary benefit that only adds free power.


Yes, the attack speed debuff's removal did only come with a health regen buff (that was later nerfed), yet he is still thought of by most of the player base as one of the strongest champs in the game. The removal of spell vamp would do the same thing in that it removes a portion of the champ that only added power instead of giving the champion interesting dynamics in how they are played and how they are contrplayed.


You know that "dodge the skill-shot" excuse kind of lost its effectiveness after Riot reworked Nidalee for exactly this reason. These champions barely face any consequence for their actions, yet the second you make one mistake they screw you over with no possibility to fight back.

The entire premise of your discussion hinges on the hypothesis that you believe that Lee needs a nerf when he really doesn't. 

As you would have others believe, is that Lee is overpowered because of his versatility. The problem isn't that Lee is too versatile, it's that other jungler options are NOT. We need more diversity in the jungle and more versatility, not less! 

Spell vamp on Lee is unique among other AD assassins who do not get this benefit, but aside from that matter, the spell vamp benefit still requires Lee to activate 80 of his energy. It was earlier stated that Lee would not readily activate the Iron Will in the heat of a battle because it would take from his energy pool, and it could hinder Lee's use of his other, more important skills.

If Lee doesn't benefit from the skill in battle, then you want to nerf it so he has a weaker sustain in jungle only. Nearly every jungler role has innate sustain in their kit design to combat the fact that junglers are constantly taking damage from their camps in order to farm, which no one else does.

If every jungler has sustain built into their kit, why would you argue for removal from only one of those junglers?

the answer is simple: you're trying to gimp a champion. so just stahp.

Lee has been released for something like 2 1/2 years already and if you haven't adapted to him by now you should probably just choose another game instead of trying to get some peoples' favourite champion nerfed.

Please just learn to play against Lee, find out what works and what doesn't work for yourself instead of resorting to asking for nerfs because we all know that this is the least viable solution for you to deal with this problem in the immediate future.

There's plenty of diversity in the jungle. They're just all gated behind Lee Sin being the obviously superior pick for 2 and a half years straight.

Lee Sin still has innate lifesteal. He still has sustain even without spell vamp. Plenty of junglers do fine without any sustain at all, I'm sure Lee Sin will be fine without a SECOND unnecessary form of sustain.

Despite nothing but nerfs since his inception, Lee Sin has still been one of if not THE top jungle pick for 2 and a half years straight. If you don't think that's a problem, you're delusional. I don't want him nerfed to the point of not being viable, but at some point Lee Sin needs to give up that throne.

But... But... 

e$ports!

So you would rather have a few champions who do everything, instead of multiple that each effect the game sofferently?

If some champs can do everything why would you ever pick the ones that are more niche.

> [{quoted}](name=Raise Dongrs,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=F7mza234,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2014-12-23T17:34:31.904+0000)
>
> It's so his E helps him sustain a fight and give him a boost of HP (As it applies magic damage).

That's not how spell vamp works. Spell Vamp returns HP based on ability damage, not magic damage. I.e., if I'm Pantheon and have 20% spell vamp and chucking spears all over the place (doing physical damage), I get 20% of the HP back of each spear's damage because it is a spell (a.k.a. an ability), not because of the damage type.

Put another way: life steal effects auto attacks and spell vamp effects abilities (regardless of dealing physical, magic, or true damage - it even applies to damage from Smite).

So Lee Sin's spell vamp applies to **all** of his damaging abilities.
The only exceptions to those rules are specifically stated in ability tooltips.  Specifically "applies on-hit effects."

Absolutely correct, I just couldn't remember exactly how the rules worked with them (e.g. Nasus Q, or Sheen, or Ezreal Q, or Fizz W Active), and felt like it was a minutiae that could be left out.

Also, I think it's technically "on next hit" effects, not "applies on-hit effects" that are the ones that act strangely.
Nasus Q is weird, it applies the lifesteal to the bonus damage. Most next-hit spells won't do that, and only apply it to the base AD that goes along with that attack.

I think the way it works is that attacks that add a bonus onto the basic attack don't have lifesteal applied but attacks that increase the damage of the next attack do.

What I mean is Siphoning Strike deals 100% of his basic attack damage (or his AD) plus the base damage plus stacks. So it's 100% AD + Base + Stacks.

While an ability such as Vi's Excessive Force deal its base damage + AD/AP ratios on top of her basic attack.

So attacks that replace the basic attack damage apply lifesteal while the ones that add bonus damage on top of it don't. If that makes sense.

Honestly I wouldn't really mined if they removed the life steal and spell vamp from iron will and just remade it into a more interesting skill. 

You look around lee sins kit and you have all the awesome abilities that can combo together in unique ways and then there's iron will, which just sits there as the block of power with no real game play attached. The only think its really useful for in combat is the spell vamp smite a creep to help you live with low HP.  Iron will is just a boring poorly designed skill.

The reason they removed the Armor and like the sustain better is because the former is not interactive and the latter is. You have to use abilities and hit people to mitigate damage if you have sustain, if you have resistances you don't need to do anything to mitigate damage. 

I would like them to shift it to lifesteal so that you have to actually fight things with your fists as a martial artist to mitigate anything.

That might have been the plan but that's not how it works. Its very rare lee sin needs to use iron will in combat, in fact its discouraged because it waste energy, the only time you will see a lee sin with his iron will on is if he either sustaining in the jungle or if he made a mistake and doubled tapped safeguard(there is also the spell-vamp smite for a bit of HP during a close fight, but that's pretty rarely used). 

The reason the armor was more interactive then the sustain is that it only lasted a few seconds. You needed to time your activation of iron will to your enemy unloading their physical damage on you to make the most of it. The sustain on the other hand can be activated mindlessly in the jungle to insure that lee sin health stays high.

In the end it simply comes down to iron will being a boring skill. When compared to the rest of his kit it just feels so out of place. Everything else in his kit flows together so nicely and the sustain from iron will just feels like a bit of tact on power.
